name: Nidoqueen

attacks.name: Boyfriends
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Nidoking you have in play.

flavorText: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

strengths: 90 HP is solid for a Stage 2
Boyfriends can deal up to 60+ damage for 1 energy with Nidokings in play
Mega Punch is a consistent 50 damage
Grass type is effective against Water Pokemon
weaknesses: Stage 2 requires significant setup (Nidoran F -> Nidorina -> Nidoqueen)
Boyfriends requires Nidoking in play to be efficient
Running both evolution lines is deck-space intensive
Psychic weakness is problematic against Alakazam/Gengar
synergies: Pokemon Breeder - skip Stage 1 for faster evolution
Double Colorless Energy - helps power Mega Punch
Switch - work around heavy retreat cost
counters: Evolution denial (Gust of Wind on basics)
Decks that don't give time to set up both evolution lines

competitiveHistory: Nidoqueen from Jungle saw very limited competitive play. While the Boyfriends attack had interesting synergy with Nidoking, requiring two separate Stage 2 evolution lines made the deck too slow and inconsistent for tournament play. The Nidoking/Nidoqueen archetype was considered a fun casual deck but could not compete with faster strategies like Haymaker or more efficient evolution decks like Rain Dance. Mega Punch was decent but not worth the evolution investment.

rulings.ruling: Boyfriends counts all Nidoking you have in play, including on the bench.
If you have multiple Nidoking in play, each one adds 20 damage to Boyfriends.
